Package manager

Class Manager

java.lang.Object
manager.Manager
public class Manager extends Object
Connects actions on the GUI to computations performed and data retrieved from other classes. Operates on the singleton pattern.
Author:
Hunter Pruitt

    • removeAnime

      public void removeAnime(int idx)
      Removes a selected anime from the animeList
      Parameters:
      idx - index to remove from
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the passed index is out of bounds

    • getAllAnimeAsArray

      public Object[][] getAllAnimeAsArray()
      Grabs title, year, and count for each anime for display on the GUI. Return is type Object[][] so that ints and Strings are both displayed in the table together. It could be type String[][], but ultimately doesn't matter. The sorting for this method is dependant on the sorting method of the list that the pointer animeList is set to. This pointer can be changed by the user in the OptionsView
      Returns:
      2D array of anime data for display on the GUI

    • setSortMethod

      public void setSortMethod(Preferences.SortFocus sortBy)
      Changes the sorting method and retrieves the proper animeList to use
      Parameters:
      sortBy - SortFocus to sort anime by

    • setColorMethod

      public void setColorMethod(Preferences.ColorMethod colorBy)
      Changes the sorting method and retrieves the proper animeList to use
      Parameters:
      colorBy - ColorMethod to sort anime by

    • setColor

      public void setColor(String pointer, Color c)
      Sets the designated color to the color passed as a parameter
      Parameters:
      pointer - String name indicating which user color is to be changed
      c - Color to set the user color to
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if passed a bad pointer

    • getEntryCount

      public String getEntryCount()
      Returns the number of entries for use as a stat on the HomeView
      Returns:
      total number of entries

      public String getCountSum()

      Returns:
      sum of all anime counts

    • getFavoredLanguageAndPercent

      public String getFavoredLanguageAndPercent()
      Computes the most used language type by entry (not count) and the percent for display
      Returns:
      most used language and its percent as a String for the GUI, "N/A" if list is empty

    • getPercentFinished

      public String getPercentFinished()
      Provides a string representation of the user's percent of finished anime, followed by the percent sign (%)
      Returns:
      percent of total anime finished, "N/A" if list is empty

    • getPercentDropped

      public String getPercentDropped()
      Provides a string representation of the user's percent of dropped anime, followed by the percent sign (%)
      Returns:
      percent of total anime dropped, "N/A" if list is empty
